docs.snippet: After a long diplomatic struggle, the nation joined Mercosur’s four full members, including Brazil, which was influential in the admission decision.
docs.lead_paragraph: After a long diplomatic struggle, the nation joined Mercosur’s four full members, including Brazil, which was influential in the admission decision.
docs.abstract: Venezuela is admitted to South America's Mercosur trading bloc following years of wrangling over its status; move, which reflects the regional influence wielded by Brazil, follows the temporary suspension of Paraguay, which had stiffly opposed Venezuela's membership.

headline.seo: Mercosur Trade Bloc Admits Venezuela as Full Member
headline.main: With Brazil as Advocate, Venezuela Joins Trade Bloc
headline.print_headline: With Brazil as Advocate, Venezuela Joins Trade Bloc

byline.contributor: Maria Eugenia Diaz contributed reporting from Caracas, Venezuela.

docs.snippet: Major League Soccer is negotiating to locate its 20th franchise in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park as its first New York City team.
docs.lead_paragraph: Major League Soccer is negotiating to locate its 20th franchise in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park as its first New York City team.
docs.abstract: Officials of Major League Soccer are negotiating to locate a 20th franchise in Flushing Meadows-Corona Park, in what would be New York City's first professional soccer team; new stadium would hold about 25,000 spectators and construction would create more than 2,000 temporary jobs and 300 permanent ones; proposed team does not yet have a name or an owner.

headline.seo: Major League Soccer Plans a Team and a Stadium in Queens
headline.main: Soccer Enthusiasts Hope for a Stadium and a Pro Team in Queens
headline.print_headline: Soccer Enthusiasts Hope For a Stadium in Queens

docs.snippet: Granting Mr. Assange asylum provides a politically timely reminder of President Correa’s leadership style at home — and his potential for leadership beyond Ecuador’s borders.
docs.lead_paragraph: Granting Mr. Assange asylum provides a politically timely reminder of President Correa’s leadership style at home — and his potential for leadership beyond Ecuador’s borders.
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Prof Anita Isaacs asserts that Ecuador's decision to grant asylum to WikiLeaks founder Julian Assange is a reminder of Pres Rafael Correa's leadership style at home, and his potential should he assume a leadership role on the Latin American left.

headline.seo: Why Correa Lets Assange Stay in Ecuador Embassy

docs.snippet: The latest soccer game between South Korea and Japan ended in a diplomatic row after midfielder Park Jong-woo held up a banner referring to a group of islands that are claimed by both countries located in a body of water whose name they also argue...
docs.abstract: The latest soccer game between South Korea and Japan ended in a diplomatic row after midfielder Park Jong-woo held up a banner referring to a group of islands that are claimed by both countries located in a body of water whose name they also argue over. But besides that incident, the stature of the two Asian rivals is rising in world soccer.

headline.main: South Korea and Japan: Old Rivalry, New Expectations

docs.snippet: The Korean evangelist’s Unification Church was notable for mass weddings, fresh-faced proselytizers and links to vast commercial interests.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Korean evangelist’s Unification Church was notable for mass weddings, fresh-faced proselytizers and links to vast commercial interests.
docs.abstract: Rev Sun Myung Moon, Korean evangelist, businessman and self-proclaimed messiah who built the religious movement known as the Unification Church, dies at age 92.

headline.seo: Rev. Sun Myung Moon, 92, Unification Church Founder, Dies
headline.main: Rev. Sun Myung Moon, Self-Proclaimed Messiah Who Built Religious Movement, Dies at 92
headline.print_headline: Rev. Sun Myung Moon, Founder of the Unification Church, Dies at 92
